text:
>Valkyrie in game: most armor
>Valkyrie on cover of game: ... Still the most armored, despite being half naked.

Points for consistency there. Armor's pretty useless against a horde of ghosts anyway.
author: Dessa

text: My nightmares of the pixeled hoards will recur tonight.
author: Zack C

text: This game damn hard as a kid
author: Beau -

text:
Oh gosh, this game took me sooooo long to beat the first time.  Always got stuck in dead end levels at the end.

Only when I came back to this game years later that I finally found level 99.  And then after a few more stumbles, finally getting to the end.  Felt so satisfying on that first time victory, even though the actual ending was rather bland, lol
author: pixcalibur123

text: @pixcalibur123 I didn't think the game ever ended!  Whoa.

text: I personally think the song "Sortie" from Gauntlet 4 on the Genesis is the best Gauntlet series song. This one's a great classic though. Aged really nicely.

text: Is this actually a Bach song?  If so, what's the name of the song?
author: Dessa

text: @Dessa i don't think it's a bach song, it just takes inspiration from bach; there's a lot of his style in it, a lot of counterpoint, etc.

I never did get to play the originals from so long ago, but I did play Dark Legacy for ps2 and my god, did I ever enjoy the hell out of it.

text: I'm kind of surprised that you haven't done any music from Gauntlet Dark Legacy yet.
author: darkseid1321

text: A 1987 NES classic. I don't know if this dungeon crawler aged well, but this theme certainly did with its surprising build-up. I remember spending a lot of time (and money) with friends on Gauntlet Legends' Arcade version during lunch break back in the late 90s. Good times!
